title: Istighfar
arabic: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ
latin: astagh-firullah
translation: I seek forgiveness from Allah.
benefits: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, finished his prayer, he would seek forgiveness three times and recite the dhikr above. Al-Auza'i stated that the recitation of istighfar is 'Astaghfirullah, Astaghfirullah.'
source: HR. Muslim No. 591

title: Allah, The Giver of Peace
arabic: اَللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلاَمُ، وَمِنْكَ السَّلاَمُ، تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَاْلإِكْرَامِ
latin: allahumma antas salaam wa minkas salaam tabaarokta ya dzal jalaali wal ikrom
translation: O Allah, You are Peace, and from You is peace. Blessed are You, O Possessor of majesty and honor.
benefits: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, finished his prayer, he would seek forgiveness three times and recite the dhikr above. Al-Auza'i stated that the recitation of istighfar is 'Astaghfirullah, Astaghfirullah.'
source: HR. Muslim No. 591

title: Allah, The Preventer and The Giver of All Things
arabic: لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرُ، اَللَّهُمَّ لاَ مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلاَ مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلاَ يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
latin: laa ilaha illallah wahdahu laa syarika lah, lahul mulku wa lahul hamdu wa huwa 'ala kulli syai-in qodiir. allahumma laa maani'a lima a'thoita wa laa mu'thiya limaa mana'ta wa laa yanfau dzal jaddi minkal jaddu
translation: There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, He has no partner. To Him belongs dominion and praise, and He is over all things competent. O Allah, there is no preventer of what You give, and no giver of what You withhold, and wealth and honor do not benefit their possessor (except faith and righteous deeds that save from punishment). Only from You is wealth and honor.
source: HR. Bukhari No. 844 and Muslim No. 593

title: Allah, The Possessor of All and The Only One Worthy of Worship
arabic: لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرُ. لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللهِ، لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ، وَلاَ نَعْبُدُ إِلاَّ إِيَّاهُ، لَهُ النِّعْمَةُ وَلَهُ الْفَضْلُ وَلَهُ الثَّنَاءُ الْحَسَنُ، لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ مُخْلِصِيْنَ لَهُ الدِّيْنَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الْكَافِرُوْنَ
latin: laa ilaha illallah wahdahu laa syarika lah. lahul mulku wa lahul hamdu wa huwa 'ala kulli syai-in qodiir. laa hawla wa laa quwwata illa billah. laa ilaha illallah wa laa na'budu illa iyyah. lahun ni'mah wa lahul fadhl wa lahuts tsanaaul hasan. laa ilaha illallah mukhlishiina lahud diin wa law karihal kaafiruun
translation: There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, He has no partner. To Him belongs dominion and praise, and He is over all things competent. There is no power and no strength except by Allah. There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, and we do not worship except Him. To Him belongs all favor, grace, and good praise. There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, making our religion sincerely for Him, even if the disbelievers dislike it.
benefits: 'Abdullah bin Zubair said, "The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to recite the tahlil (laa ilaha illallah) at the end of the prayer."
source: HR. Muslim No. 594

title: Tasbih
arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ
latin: subhanallah
translation: Glory be to Allah

title: Tahmid
arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
latin: alhamdulillah
translation: All praise is for Allah

title: Takbir
arabic: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ
latin: allahu akbar
translation: Allah is the Greatest

title: There is No Partner for Allah, and To Him Belongs All Things
arabic: لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرُ
latin: laa ilaha illallah wahda, laa syarika lah. lahul mulku wa lahul hamdu wa huwa 'ala kulli syai-in qodiir
translation: There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, He has no partner. To Him belongs dominion and praise, and He is over all things competent.
benefits: Whoever recites the dhikr above, his sins will be forgiven, even if they are as numerous as the foam on the ocean. Imam Nawawi, may Allah have mercy on him, said that the text of the hadith indicates that 'Subhanallah', 'Alhamdulillah', and 'Allahu akbar' are each recited 33 times separately.
source: Syarh Shahih Muslim, 5: 84

title: Ayat al-Kursi
arabic: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْحَىُّ ٱلْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُۥ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَّهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ مَن ذَا ٱلَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَـُٔودُهُۥ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
latin: Allāhu lā ilāha illā huw, al-ḥayyul-qayyụm, lā ta`khużuhụ sinatuw wa lā na`ụm, lahụ mā fis-samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍ, man żallażī yasyfa'u 'indahū illā bi`iżnih, ya'lamu mā baina aidīhim wa mā khalfahum, wa lā yuḥīṭụna bisyai`im min 'ilmihī illā bimā syā`, wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samāwāti wal-arḍ, wa lā ya`ụduhụ ḥifẓuhumā, wa huwal-'aliyyul-'aẓīm
translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
benefits: Whoever recites Ayat al-Kursi after finishing the prayer, nothing will prevent him from entering Paradise except death.
source: HR. an-Nasai in Al-Kubro 9: 44. This hadith is declared sahih by Ibn Hibban, as mentioned by Ibn Hajar in Bulughul Maram

title: Al-Ikhlas
arabic: قُلْ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ (1) ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ (2) لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ (3) وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌۢ (4)
latin: qul huwallāhu aḥad (1) allāhuṣ-ṣamad (2) lam yalid wa lam yụlad (3) wa lam yakul lahụ kufuwan aḥad (4)
translation: Say, "He is Allah , [who is] One, (1) Allah , the Eternal Refuge. (2) He neither begets nor is born, (3) Nor is there to Him any equivalent." (4)
benefits: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Recite Qul huwallahu ahad, and Al-Mu'awwidhatayn (Al-Falaq and An-Nas) in the evening and morning three times, and it will suffice you (protect you) from everything.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1523 and an-Nasa'i No. 1337. Al Hafizh Abu Thohir said that the chain of this hadith is hasan

title: Al-Falaq
arabic: قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْفَلَقِ (1) مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ (2) وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ (3) وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّٰثَٰتِ فِى ٱلْعُقَدِ (4) وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ (5)
latin: qul a'ụżu birabbil-falaq (1) min syarri mā khalaq (2) wa min syarri gāsiqin iżā waqab (3) wa min syarrin-naffāṡāti fil-'uqad (4) wa min syarri ḥāsidin iżā ḥasad (5)
translation: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak (1) From the evil of that which He created (2) And from the evil of darkness when it settles (3) And from the evil of the blowers in knots (4) And from the evil of an envier when he envies." (5)
benefits: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Recite Qul huwallahu ahad, and Al-Mu'awwidhatayn (Al-Falaq and An-Nas) in the evening and morning three times, and it will suffice you (protect you) from everything.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1523 and an-Nasa'i No. 1337. Al Hafizh Abu Thohir said that the chain of this hadith is hasan

title: An-Naas
arabic: قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ (1) مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ (2) إِلَٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ (3) مِن شَرِّ ٱلْوَسْوَاسِ ٱلْخَنَّاسِ (4) ٱلَّذِى يُوَسْوِسُ فِى صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ (5) مِنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ (6)
latin: qul a'ụżu birabbin-nās (1) malikin-nās (2) ilāhin-nās (3) min syarril-waswāsil-khannās (4) allażī yuwaswisu fī ṣudụrin-nās (5) minal-jinnati wan-nās (6)
translation: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, (1) The King of mankind. (2) The God of mankind, (3) From the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, (4) Who whispers in the breasts of mankind, (5) Of the jinn and mankind." (6)
benefits: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Recite Qul huwallahu ahad, and Al-Mu'awwidhatayn (Al-Falaq and An-Nas) in the evening and morning three times, and it will suffice you (protect you) from everything.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1523 and an-Nasa'i No. 1337. Al Hafizh Abu Thohir said that the chain of this hadith is hasan

title: Supplication for Beneficial Knowledge, Good Provision, and Accepted Deeds
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا وَعَمَلاً مُتَقَبَّلاً
latin: allahumma innii as-aluka 'ilman naafi'a, wa rizqan thayyiba, wa 'amalan mutaqabbala
translation: O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, good provision, and accepted deeds.
notes: Read 1x after the salam of Fajr prayer
benefits: Beneficial knowledge is a provision that makes life easier, obtaining good provision is a person's goal in working, and accepted deeds are the hope of every person who performs good deeds. Therefore, a servant should always ask for these 3 things every morning before starting their various activities.
source: HR. Ibn Majah No. 925 and Ahmad 6: 305, 322. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Protection Against Evil
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْفَقْرِ، وَالْقِلَّةِ، وَالذِّلَّةِ، وَأَنْ أَظْلِمَ أَوْ أُظْلَمَ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika minal faqri, wal qillati, wadz dzillati, wa an azlima aw uzlam
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from poverty, lack, humiliation, and that I oppress or be oppressed.
benefits: This supplication protects against material difficulties and injustices. The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم used to recite this supplication after his prayers to protect himself from the trials of this world.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1544 and an-Nasa'i No. 1346. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Faith and Good End
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَسْأَلُكَ الْهُدَى، وَالتُّقَى، وَالْعَفَافَ، وَالْغِنَى
latin: allahumma innii as-alukal huda, wat tuqo, wal 'afaafa, wal ghina
translation: O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and independence.
benefits: This supplication covers the essential aspects of spiritual and material life. Guidance for the heart, piety for actions, chastity for behavior, and independence to avoid dependence on others.
source: HR. Muslim No. 2721

title: Supplication for Protection Against Calamity
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ جَهْدِ الْبَلاَءِ، وَدَرَكِ الشَّقَاءِ، وَسُوءِ الْقَضَاءِ، وَشَمَاتَةِ الأَعْدَاءِ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika min jahdil bala'i, wa darakis syaqa'i, wa su'il qadha'i, wa syamatatil a'da'i
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the intensity of trial, the attainment of misery, bad destiny, and the malicious joy of enemies.
benefits: This supplication protects against difficult trials, misfortunes, bad decisions, and the joy of enemies in our difficulties. It is particularly recommended after prayers.
source: HR. Bukhari No. 6347 and Muslim No. 2707

title: Supplication for Divine Mercy
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَسْأَلُكَ رَحْمَةً مِنْ عِنْدِكَ تَهْدِى بِهَا قَلْبِى، وَتَجْمَعُ بِهَا أَمْرِى، وَتَلُمُّ بِهَا شَعْثِى، وَتُصْلِحُ بِهَا غَايَبِى، وَتَرْفَعُ بِهَا شَاهِدِى، وَتُزَكِّى بِهَا عَمَلِى، وَتُلْهِمُنِى بِهَا رُشْدِى، وَتَرُدُّ بِهَا أُلْفَتِى، وَتَعْصِمُنِى بِهَا مِنْ كُلِّ سُوءٍ
latin: allahumma innii as-aluka rahmatan min 'indika tahdii bihaa qalbii, wa tajma'u bihaa amrii, wa talummu bihaa sya'thii, wa tuslihu bihaa ghaayabii, wa tarfa'u bihaa syaahidii, wa tuzakkii bihaa 'amalii, wa tulhimunii bihaa rusydii, wa taruddu bihaa ulfatii, wa ta'shimunii bihaa min kulli suu'in
translation: O Allah, I ask You for mercy from You that guides my heart, gathers my affairs, repairs my tears, improves my faults, elevates my testimony, purifies my deeds, inspires me with guidance, returns my familiarity, and protects me from all evil.
benefits: This comprehensive supplication covers all aspects of spiritual and material life. It asks for divine mercy to guide the heart, organize affairs, repair faults, and protect from all evil.
source: HR. Al-Hakim in Al-Mustadrak 1: 509. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Protection Against Anxiety and Sadness
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ، وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ، وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ، وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika minal hammi wal hazan, wal 'ajzi wal kasal, wal bukhli wal jubn, wa dala'id dain, wa ghalabatir rijaal
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from anxiety and sadness, weakness and laziness, miserliness and cowardice, the burden of debt, and the domination of men.
benefits: This supplication protects against psychological troubles and social difficulties. It is particularly useful for those going through difficult periods or who have important responsibilities.
source: HR. Bukhari No. 6369 and Muslim No. 2706

title: Supplication for Protection Against the Trial of the Grave
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، وَعَذَابِ النَّارِ، وَفِتْنَةِ الْمَحْيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ، وَشَرِّ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika min 'adzaabil qabri, wa 'adzaabin naar, wa fitnatil mahyaa wal mamaat, wa syarri fitnatil masiihid dajjaal
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the punishment of the grave, the punishment of the fire, the trial of life and death, and the evil of the trial of the false Messiah.
benefits: This supplication protects against the trials of the hereafter and the tribulations of this world. It is particularly important as it covers the most feared trials by believers.
source: HR. Muslim No. 588

title: Supplication for Protection Against Disbelief and Poverty
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُفْرِ وَالْفَقْرِ، وَعَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika minal kufri wal faqr, wa 'adzaabil qabr
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from disbelief and poverty, and the punishment of the grave.
benefits: This short but powerful supplication protects against the greatest evils: disbelief which destroys faith, poverty which weakens, and the punishment of the grave which is feared.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1545 and an-Nasa'i No. 1347. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Protection Against Bad Character
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِى، وَمِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ دَابَّةٍ أَنْتَ آخِذٌ بِنَاصِيَتِهَا، إِنَّ رَبِّى عَلَى صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika min syarri nafsii, wa min syarri kulli daabbatin anta aakhidzun binaasiyatihaa, inna rabbii 'alaa shiroothim mustaqiim
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the evil of my soul and from the evil of every creature whose forelock You hold. My Lord is on a straight path.
benefits: This supplication protects against the evil inclinations of the soul and against the harm of other creatures. It recognizes that only Allah can protect us from all evils.
source: HR. Muslim No. 2717

title: Supplication for Protection Against Envy
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْحَسَدِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبَغْيِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْغِشِّ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْغِلِّ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْغَدْرِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْخِذْلَانِ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika minal hasad, wa a'udzu bika minal baghyi, wa a'udzu bika minal ghisy, wa a'udzu bika minal ghil, wa a'udzu bika minal ghadr, wa a'udzu bika minal khidzlaan
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from envy, I seek refuge with You from oppression, I seek refuge with You from deception, I seek refuge with You from rancor, I seek refuge with You from betrayal, I seek refuge with You from abandonment.
benefits: This supplication protects against bad character traits that can destroy social and spiritual relationships. It covers the most destructive vices for the soul and society.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1546 and an-Nasa'i No. 1348. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Protection Against Disease
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبَرَصِ، وَالْجُنُونِ، وَالْجُذَامِ، وَمِنْ سَيِّئِ الأَسْقَامِ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika minal barash, wal junuun, wal judzaam, wa min sayyi'il asqaam
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from leprosy, madness, leprosy, and bad diseases.
benefits: This supplication protects against serious diseases and afflictions that can affect physical and mental health. It is particularly important for maintaining good health.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1554 and an-Nasa'i No. 1352. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Protection Against Poverty and Humiliation
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْفَقْرِ، وَالْقِلَّةِ، وَالذِّلَّةِ، وَأَنْ أَظْلِمَ أَوْ أُظْلَمَ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika minal faqr, wal qillati, wadz dzillati, wa an azlima aw uzlam
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from poverty, lack, humiliation, and that I oppress or be oppressed.
benefits: This supplication protects against material and social difficulties. It asks for protection against poverty which weakens, lack which limits, and humiliation which degrades.
source: HR. Abu Dawud No. 1544 and an-Nasa'i No. 1346. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Protection Against Bad Neighbors
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ جَارِ السُّوءِ فِى دَارِ الْمُقَامِ، فَإِنَّ جَارَ الْبَادِيَةِ يَتَحَوَّلُ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika min jaaris suu'i fii daaril muqaam, fa inna jaaral baadiyati yatahawwal
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the bad neighbor in the permanent residence, for the nomadic neighbor can move away.
benefits: This supplication protects against bad neighbors who can make life difficult. It is particularly important for those who live in permanent residences.
source: HR. Al-Hakim in Al-Mustadrak 1: 510. Al-Hafizh Abu Thohir said that this hadith is sahih

title: Supplication for Protection Against Bad Actions
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِى، وَمِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ دَابَّةٍ أَنْتَ آخِذٌ بِنَاصِيَتِهَا، إِنَّ رَبِّى عَلَى صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
latin: allahumma innii a'udzu bika min syarri nafsii, wa min syarri kulli daabbatin anta aakhidzun binaasiyatihaa, inna rabbii 'alaa shiroothim mustaqiim
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the evil of my soul and from the evil of every creature whose forelock You hold. My Lord is on a straight path.
benefits: This supplication protects against the evil inclinations of the soul and against the harm of other creatures. It recognizes that only Allah can protect us from all evils.
source: HR. Muslim No. 2717
